@bitprophet It's just that I'm, like, terminally ill, so I'm trying to find places to dump projects that won't die instantly when I do
I thought Launchpad would be sufficient but apparently people just ignore shit on LP

My goal is not to convince people to move to Launchpad, my goal is to convince people Launchpad is not bad enough to warrant ignoring projects that use it -- it seems there's lots of Github users that expect it to be github and conclude it sucks, and it probably does
(am I off-topic??)

@j2d2 Assigning bugs to people, pull requests being attached to issue tracker artifacts but issue tracker artifacts themselves, states beyond "open" and "closed", either more states or a distinction between "state" and "resolution" (yay queryable metadata), priority and severity, saved queries, assigning branches to bugs, are the first things that spring to mind. If it could track downstream like Launchpad that'd be extra awesome.
Yeah, I'm no fan of launchpad -- for mostly the reasons @zedshaw mentioned -- but github's issue tracker and handling of pull requests are bloody awful.
@moogatronic There are no good bagels in CA, trust me
